## Create normal distribution with skewness


```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(moments)
set.seed(1234)
tn <- rnorm(100000, mean = 10)
qplot(tn, geom = 'histogram', bins = 100) + xlab('Numbers')
skewness(tn)
tr <- tn ^ 6
qplot(tr, geom = 'histogram', bins = 100) + xlab('Numbers')
skewness(tr)
tl <- sqrt(log10(tn))
qplot(tl, geom = 'histogram', bins = 100) + xlab('Numbers')
skewness(tl)
n.sample <- rnorm(n = 10000, mean = 55, sd = 4.5)
skewness(n.sample)
qplot(tl, geom = 'histogram', bins = 100) + xlab('Numbers')
datasim <- data.frame(n.sample)
ggplot(datasim, aes(x = n.sample), binwidth = 2) + 
       geom_histogram(aes(y = ..density..), fill = 'red', alpha = 0.5) + 
       geom_density(colour = 'blue') + xlab(expression(bold('Simulated Samples'))) + 
       ylab(expression(bold('Density')))
```

## Create beta distribution with skewness

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(moments)
set.seed(1234)
tn <- rbeta(10000,5,5)
qplot(tn, geom = 'histogram', binwidth = 0.01) + xlab('Numbers')
mean(tn)
median(tn)
tl <- rbeta(10000,2,5)
qplot(tl, geom = 'histogram', binwidth = 0.01) + xlab('Numbers')
mean(tl)
median(tl)
tr <- rbeta(10000,5,2)
qplot(tr, geom = 'histogram', binwidth = 0.01) + xlab('Numbers')
mean(tr)
median(tr)
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(moments)
set.seed(1234)
x <- rnorm(10000)
all.moments(x, order.max = 4)
all.moments(x, central = TRUE, order.max = 4)
all.moments(x, absolute = TRUE, order.max = 4)
all.moments(x, central = TRUE, absolute = TRUE, order.max = 4)
```

## Generate perfect normal distribution manually

```{r generate-perfect-normal-distribution}
library(ggplot2)
library(moments)
t <- c(
    rep(65, 3),
    rep(70, 6),
    rep(75, 9),
    rep(80,12),
    rep(85,15),
    rep(90,18),
    rep(95,21),
    rep(100,24),
    rep(135, 3),
    rep(130, 6),
    rep(125, 9),
    rep(120,12),
    rep(115,15),
    rep(110,18),
    rep(105,21)
    )
qplot(t, geom = 'histogram', binwidth = 5) + xlab('Numbers')
```

## Create perfect normal distribution programmatically

```{r generate-perfect-normal-distribution-2}
library(ggplot2)
library(moments)
x <- 1
t <- NULL
for (i in 65:100) {
    t <- c(t, rep(i,x))
    x <- x + 1
}
x <- 35
for (j in 101:135) {
    t <- c(t, rep(j,x))
    x <- x - 1
}
qplot(t, geom = 'histogram', binwidth = 3) + xlab('Numbers')
```
